history.narrative: Law 18-219, the “Anti-Graffiti Act of 2010”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-69, which was referred to the Committee on Public Safety and the Judiciary and the Committee on Public Works and Transportation. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 2, 2010, and April 20, 2010, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 7, 2010, it was assigned Act No. 18-396 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-219 became effective on September 18, 2010.
